intro: Labordia fagraeoidea var. simulans, commonly known as the dwarf fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, glossy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
